rev.desc.rev.desc: When you close an Interaction (log) the opened.by field has Corp ID.
revert the changes made by 68365, add new field: opened.by.uid and updated.by.uid in incidents file to always store operator name;
open.by and updated.by store only operator name
in panel start, modify

if same(nullsub(full.name in $G.sm.environment, full.name in $G.sm.global.environment), true) then ($L.operator=nullsub($lo.ufname, nullsub(operator(), "NULL"))) else ($L.operator=nullsub(operator(), "NULL"))
to
$L.operator=nullsub(operator(), "NULL")
line 6 modified "SD.update.call" to "SD.update.interaction"
line 21 on start panel - changed SM.incident.qbe to SD.incident.qbe
line 6 on start panel - changed SM.update.call to SD.update.call
I1492 in devtx
Line 21 of start panel from:
$L.dd.qbe.format=nullsub($INTO.FORMAT, nullsub(qbe.format in $G.sm.environment, "cc.incident.qbe"))
To:
$L.dd.qbe.format=nullsub($INTO.FORMAT, nullsub(qbe.format in $G.sm.environment, "SM.incident.qbe"))
No SCR: Changed cc.incident to SM.update.call. This was missed after changing the form name.
Changed line 6 from:
$L.format.name=nullsub(edit.format in $G.sm.environment, "cc.incident")
To:
$L.format.name=nullsub(edit.format in $G.sm.environment, "SM.update.call")
Removed extraneous panels.
Removed extraneous panels.
Modified for new parameter in us.incident.matching
Set mode to browse after moving to another record from a cloned record.
Fixed parens on prompt.no
Replaced call to cc.find.problem with us.incident.matching.
Also checks for check.rc and check.ke flags in Incident environment record.

In SC4, due to global locking and a new rtecall for "tag", updated application cc.edit.incident to use the new rtecall when doing an unlock. This was done in a new panel clone.set.unlock. Passed the locked name to clone.unlock. Also did it for the Clear option (panels clear.set.unlock & clear.unlock)
Externalized add, update and close messages by calling us.notify instead of message.
Modified set.iknow to handle the Knowlix return string differently when on an mvs system.
Changed the normal exit in getnumb to clone.copy.fields to call us.copy.open.link.
(-11391/-10282) Added a call to us.clone.relation when saving a cloned call.
Added a new process panel set.clone.unlock to turn off $L.locked after unlocking a cloned incident. New panel is being called from panel clone.unlock

Next/previous was not setting and/or releasing the lock properly. Thus, modified panel display.decide to lump "next" and "previous" to the same exit panel to check for possible locks. Deleted the "next" and "previous" panels since they both can used the same panel (new panel check.update.rec). Due to the above changes, also modified the lock.internal panel to take the setup.display.go.1 exit when a record is locked.
On panel lock.internal, set lock exit to display instead of exit.normal. Also moved the initialization of $L.dd.reclist from setup.display.go.1 to the start panel.
On panel display.decide, took out the "create" action and lumped it in with the "check.locked" panel exit. Also changed $L.act="create" to be in $L.action="create" in panel done.save
Knowlix integration changes.
Changed prompt.cancel.go no exit from display to display.go so that $inc.update info won't disappear when user decides not to abandon his changes.
$L.traverse was not resetting $INTO.TRAVERSE
$L.title changes.
Added "retrieve.kpak" option.
Set the mode to browse after unlocking the record.
Now does reselect for Refresh List option (reclist).
Don't use split screen if in add mode.
Fixed exit when closing call with reclist=true.
Moved list options in for splitscreen support.
Switched to $G.sm.*
Compare $L.file and $L.old before prompting for unsaved changes when lock.on.display is true.
Converted to use scmsg().
New parameter for sc.knowledge.
Use screlate when creating problems.
Added support for a clocks button.
Call cc.required.view to view the record that caused the required action.
Moved the locking check into displayoptions.
Lock the record before calling options that can modify the record (find solution, cycle depends, ...).
Remove calls to associate applications. Associate options are now run from displayoptions (calling new screlate.associate).
Move required action processing into cc.required.actions. Now supports CM and RM records.
Change the way it calls us.print to allow override of special formats.
Fixed locking problem when editing a problem from a required action caused by calling apm.edit.problem with mode=update instead of browse.
Added text mode support for required actions.
Also added text mode support for 2nd bank back key (pf3).
Added the us.print routine for printing and incident.
nullsub the required action problem query to "false"
Added Lock on Display.
called cc.find.problem instead of apm.find.problem and expanded the check to include check.duplicates and check.parents.
Put $G.prompt.for.save on the cancel exit decision panel.
Unlock the record when UNDO is pressed.
Fixed find to use cursor.field.name() not current.field.name()
Use edit.incident.format in $G.pm.environment to get the format name to display the call.
Cbanged the titles to use "Call" instead of "Incident".
If we set the open field to "Closed" in the code then when validation is failed set it back to the starting value.

Moved the Add Required Action call into application from displayoptions. Saved record prior to calling cc.depend and reselect the record after creating Required Action. Did this because the trigger on incdepends updated the incident record.
Added a check to not process the required action if the state=inactive.
rewrote the required actions section to account for problems that are not closed.
Moved the creation of $L.format.name to the start panel and used that format as the default for generating the format control query.

descript.descript: When you close an Interaction (log) the opened.by field has Corp ID.

open.by and updated.by store only operator name

to
